answers.answer: Most of the time years after,  until the CD4 goes below 200.
so the opportunistic infections could start as soon as days?
OIs do not start in days. It takes years for most people's CD4 to drop below 200. If one knows they are positive and have a CD4 less than 200 they are given antibiotics to prevent OIs.
No, yeast infection is not an OI.
how soon would a cronic yeast show after exposure/infection?
A yeast infection is not worriesome for HIV.  Girls get them all the time.
for 2months while on several doctor prescribed meds?
I know an HIV negative woman who had recurring yeast infections for over a year.
ew dont say that.... thats gunna suck for me

nfareell...get urself tested if ur scared...u may live with hiv and may never develop opportunistic infections..as teak said when ur cd4 gets below 200 - then u become prone to infections as ur body cannot fight those infections which a person who is hiv neg can easily fight...but now with proper diet and med someone can live with hiv and may never develop oppotunistic infections..quality of life can be compared with someone who has diabetes..it all depends on ur cd4 level..why dont u see an STD doc..he will surely give u all necessary details u needall the best
Just because someone has HIV doesn't stop them from getting all the other infections as flu, colds, sinus problems, yeast infections as everyone else does.

question: opportunistic infections .. how soon after infection would they start
title: opportunistic infections
